problem.p: This is a concept question, provided to check your understanding of the previous video clip.
Which of the following statements about the dephasing channel and the depolarizing channel are correct? Check all that apply:

choice.text: The dephasing channel shrinks qubit states towards the z-axis of the Bloch sphere, whereas the depolarizing channel shrinks states to the center of the sphere.
The dephasing channel and the depolarizing channel are identical up to a rotation of the qubit.
The depolarizing channel is essentially dephasing along three directions.
The depolarizing and dephasing channels are both models of what can happen to a single qubit.
The single-qubit fully mixed state [mathjaxinline]\rho =I/2[/mathjaxinline] is unchanged under both the depolarizing and the dephasing channels.
